metadata.title: CVE-2022-20421 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In binder_inc_ref_for_node of binder.c, there is a possible way to corruptmemory due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-239630375References: Upstream kernel

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
